themes: Desire for more classical and acoustic music events
Integration of live music with cultural exhibitions
Quality and authenticity of cultural performances
Accessibility and geographic equity across Austin
Challenges posed by climate and indoor space availability
key_phrases: more classical and acoustic music more widely available
Peruvian dance exhibition at an Austin public library
they used a poor recording of the music
it would have benefited of actual pan flutes
needed a larger venue with stadium like seating
Families with children were unable to sit comfortably or see the recreation
creating space (or more accessibility to all areas of austin) for a 'Music at Noon' programming
dedicated for acoustic or small ensemble music open for family and children of all ages
challenge may be indoor space since we are in a hotter climate
More family oriented programming with quality music and art
barriers_identified: Use of poor quality recorded music instead of live instruments
Inadequate venue size and seating for families
Limited accessibility to programming across all areas of Austin
Lack of indoor spaces suitable for events due to hot climate
solutions_proposed: Provide live music (e.g., actual pan flutes) at cultural exhibitions
Use larger venues with stadium-like seating for better visibility and comfort
Create or increase accessibility to 'Music at Noon' programming for families and children
Offer more family-oriented programming with quality music and art
